title: Dental Receptionist/Dental Assistant
description:
**About Us:**  At Advanced Periodontics & Implant Dentistry, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional care in a warm, welcoming environment. We are a dedicated team of professionals committed to the highest standards of dental health and patient satisfaction. We are currently seeking a versatile and enthusiastic individual to join our team as a Dental Receptionist who can also assist our Periodontists.

**Job Overview:** As a Dental Receptionist and Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in our practice. You will be the first point of contact for our patients, ensuring a positive experience from check-in to check-out. In addition, you will support our Periodontist with various clinical tasks. We’re looking for someone with a positive attitude, flexibility, and a strong sense of responsibility who can thrive in a collaborative team environment.

**Receptionist Duties:**

* Greet patients warmly and professionally as they arrive.
* Manage patient scheduling, including appointments, cancellations, and rescheduling.
* Handle phone calls and respond to inquiries with accurate information.
* Process patient check-ins and check-outs efficiently.
* Maintain and update patient records with accuracy and confidentiality.
* Assist with billing and insurance verification, ensuring proper documentation and claims submission.
* Write letters to our referring doctors regarding our patient's visits
* Visit and drop off goodies to referring doctors
* Coordinate with other team members to ensure smooth operations.

**Dental Assistant Duties:**

* Prepare and set up treatment rooms for procedures, ensuring all necessary instruments and materials are ready.
* Assist the Periodontist during various periodontal procedures, including patient positioning and instrument handling.
* Take xrays & do digital scanning (3 Shape Trioscan).
* Educate patients on post-procedure care and oral hygiene practices.
* Sterilize and maintain dental instruments and equipment in accordance with infection control protocols.
* Track lab cases
* Provide chairside support and comfort to patients during treatments.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as a Dental Receptionist and Dental Assistant is required.
* Familiarity with Open Dental is a plus.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Positive attitude and the ability to remain calm and professional in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively and adapt to various tasks as needed.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Friendly and approachable demeanor with a genuine passion for patient care.
* Patient, responsible, and mature with a strong work ethic.
* Flexible and adaptable, willing to help where needed.
* Team player who enjoys contributing to a positive work environment.

**What We Offer:**

* A supportive and dynamic team environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary and benefits package (Sick, Vacation, 401K, Dental, Medical).
* A positive and respectful workplace culture.

title: Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE), *Grant Funded*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

Under clinical oversight, Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE), serves as part of the Sexual Assault Response Team (SART) and performs forensic evidence collection for patients who report sexual assault, including evaluation and referral. Ensures the quality of collection, documentation, and preservation of forensic evidence. Provides timely, compassionate, and patient centered care through data collection, physical assessment, health teaching, health counseling and provision of supportive care to ensure emotional support and reduce further trauma to the patient. Ensures optimal utilization of resources, service delivery and compliance with NYC Health + Hospitals, health care settings, and all relevant regulatory policies, procedures, and standards of care for better outcomes and improved patient experience.

Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE) has been developed to support the SAFE Program, as part of the Sexual Assault Response Team (SART), which ensures a timely, coordinated response and survivor-centered service that minimize trauma to sexual assault survivors.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

* Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner is expected to respond to any SAFE-designated NYC H+H health care settings within the borough in which they are hired to provide services when on call within 60 minutes of being notified by the clinical team, including those reported from inpatient departments.
* Obtains informed consent and conducts suspect evidence collection, including forensic photography, and adheres to chain of custody protocol.
* Ensures accurate collection and preservation of all forensic evidence and relevant specimens, while utilizing the New York State Sexual Offense Evidence Collection Kit, Drug Facilitated Forensic Evidence kit (if indicated), and a camera to document patient injuries as supporting evidence, in accordance with the National Protocol for Sexual Assault Medical Forensic Examinations Adults/Adolescents.
* Accurately documents findings, Sexual Assault Assessment forms and completes Crime Victim’s Board (CVB) claim forms.
* Endorses clinically relevant examination findings to primary treatment team, including Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) exposure risk, strangulation, etc.
* Identifies the components of crisis intervention and supportive techniques to be used with sexual assault survivors.
* Communicates with patients and their families regarding evidence collection, provides victim advocacy and educates sexually assaulted patients on recommended treatments, such as appropriate prophylaxis and follow-up.
* Consults appropriate personnel for medical treatment, as needed, and engages in hand off process with responsible Emergency Department Attending. If the Emergency Room Attending is not available, engages in hand off process with resident or the allied health professional responsible for patient care.
* Communicates with law enforcement and the district attorney’s office; and testifies as fact or expert witness to any cases performed.
* Escalates all clinical and operational issues to NYC Health + Hospitals Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner Borough Coordinator.
* Performs other program-related work, assigned

**Please note:**

* Multiple rotating shifts available
* Current rate structure considers Friday night as part of the weekday night shift rate
* Current rate structure only includes Saturday - Sunday night for weekend overnight shift
* This new title is for on-call purposes only and is designated for acute care facilities
* See below grid for compensation summary

**Shift Days ; Shift Times; Rates**

Day On-Call Monday - Friday (7a-7p) $350 (per shift)

Overnight On-Call Monday - Thursday (7p-7a) $375 (per shift)

Weekend Day On-Call Saturday - Sunday (7a-7p) $500 (per shift)

Weekend Overnight On-Call Friday - Sunday (7p-7a) $525 (per shift)

Holidays, including December 24 and December 31 Any Shift (7a-7p & 7p-7a) $525 (per shift)

Back Up: Day On-Call Monday - Friday (7a-7p) $175 (per shift)

Back Up: Overnight On-Call Monday - Friday (7p-7a) $200 (per shift)

Back Up: Weekend Day On-Call Saturday - Sunday (7a-7p) $250 (per shift)

Back Up: Weekend Overnight On-Call Friday - Sunday (7p-7a) $275 (per shift)

Back Up: Holidays, including December 24 and December 31 Any Shift (7a-7p & 7p-7a) $312.50 (per shift)

Additional Pay per Case $250 (per case)

Court Testimony (Includes travel to Court house) $350 (per day)

Quarterly Training/Team Building: Four 3 hr sessions/year @ $50/hour $150 (per session)

Staff are expected to travel to any SAFE-designated NYC H+H facilities within the borough in which they are hired to provide services. The following are the facilities representing each borough:

* Bronx - Jacobi
* Brooklyn - Kings County
* Manhattan - Bellevue
* Queens - Elmhurst

Response time of the SAFE must be within 60 minutes of being notified by the clinical team, including those reported from inpatient departments.

Only those who regularly work 20 hours or more per week will be eligible for Management Benefits Fund, as long as they are not receiving any other benefits in another NYC H+H facility or NYC H+H Affiliate.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. Valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse (RN) issued by the New York State Education Department (NYSED); and one (1) year of full-time clinical post-licensure experience; or  
2. Valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Nurse Practitioner (NP) issued by the NYSED; and one (1) year of full-time clinical post-licensure experience; or  
3. Valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Physician Assistant (PA) issued by the NYSED; and one (1) year of full-time clinical post-licensure experience; or  
4. Valid New York State license and current registration to practice medicine; and one (1) year of full-time clinical post-licensure experience.  
5. All applicants must successfully complete the Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE) Training Program; obtain the New York State Department of Health (NYSDOH) SAFE certification within 2 (two) months of appointment; and maintain certification for the duration of employment as a SAFE by completing fifteen (15) Continuing Medical Education (CME) credits in NYSDOH-approved coursework/training every three (3) years after the initial certification; and  
6. Holds, or obtains within 30 days of appointment, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA).

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $350.00 per day

Work Location: In person

title: Service Front Desk DARCARS Greenwich
description:
**DARCARS** is now hiring for a **Full-Time** **Service Front Desk!**


As the Service Front Deskyou are the front-line representative for the service department and must represent the dealership in a professional, friendly manner at all times. She/he greets customers as they enter the service department and directs them to the appropriate party in accordance with dealership policies and answers basic inquiries. The receptionist intercepts, screens, and routes incoming calls and takes thorough messages and provides basic information to callers. As the cashier you will manage the day-to-day flow of money transactions from customers in the service and parts department.

 **In this role, you'll:**

* Handle incoming calls and set appointments, as needed.
* Compute and record totals of transactions.
* Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
* Issue receipts, refunds, credits, or change due to customers.
* Communicate concerns to ASMs and Service Directors in a clear and effective manner.
* Receive payments by cash, check, credit cards or automatic debits.
* Responsible for filing service/customer paperwork and ensuring organization of files.
* Greet service department customers and check them in /out for their service appointment.
* Direct customers to the correct department, notify the appropriate service writer that a customer is waiting, or introduce the customer to a service writer.
* Answer basic customer inquiries and refer more extensive inquiries to the appropriate person.
* Enter data into computer operated prospect tracking system; Xtime, Reynolds.
* Manage switch board.
* Communicate with callers in a professional, friendly and efficient manner, striving to minimize the time they are put on hold.
* Take thorough messages indicating the caller’s first and last name, company name if applicable, the time, and the message the caller wishes to leave.
* Communicate messages to all appropriate parties in a timely manner.
* Provide basic information to callers who have general inquiries.
* Update and distribute company telephone roster when necessary.
* Perform clerical duties and accounting duties as assigned by controller or Service Manager.
* Other duties assigned by management.
* Make transaction receipts for sale and service department \\*if applicable

**Qualifications:**

* Must be able to speak clearly and pleasantly on the telephone and convey the image of professionalism and competence to callers and in-person customers
* Strong communication skills with both customers and DARCARS employees
* Ability to speak multiple languages (Spanish and Chinese) is a plus!
* Demonstrated commitment to customer service
* Requires the ability to speak, read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, and policy documents, as well as converse comfortably with customers
* Previous customer service experience preferred but not required
* Requires the ability to sit for long periods of time
* Be able to work in a fast-paced environment
* Be a team player
* Excellent attention to detail
* Prior experience using Reynolds or Xtime a plus!
* Prior retail, sales, service BDC, receptionist, call center, or sales BDC experience preferred
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule, evenings and weekends
* Must have a valid driver’s license and acceptable safe driving record
* High school diploma or equivalent (GED)
* Must be at least eighteen years of age
* Must be able to pass pre-employment screen (background)
* **Available to work Monday through Friday1 0:30am-7pm and every other Saturday.**

*This job advertisement in no way states or implies that these are the only duties and responsibilities to be performed by this employee. This advertisement is merely a preview of the role in solicitation. The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties and responsibilities upon the request of a supervisor.*

*DARCARS Automotive Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.*

The **Mid-Atlantic Companies** proudly stand as a pioneering force within the contracting industry. Nestled in the heart of Millstone Township, NJ, our headquarters boast a sprawling 35,000-square-foot state-of-the-art facility. Here, we harness the power of cutting-edge equipment and technology, passionately transforming our clients' visions into tangible reality with every passing day.

As a family-owned business, we’ve learned that **our people are our success**! We expect a lot from our team, so we give a lot back in return. We were voted one of NJ’s **Best Places to Work in 2023 and 2024** by NJBIZ, and here’s why:

title: Vice President of Underwriting
description:
About Us:

Flexibility Capital is a leading merchant cash advance company based in the vibrant heart of Times Square, New York City. Our mission is to offer businesses flexible financial solutions that drive growth and success. We are committed to innovation and excellence in the financial services industry.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Vice President of Underwatering to join our executive team. This role, based in our Times Square office, will lead our financial risk management efforts, and optimize our merchant cash advance portfolios. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in financial leadership and a proven track record of managing high-performance teams.

- Strategic Leadership:\\*\\* Develop and execute advanced risk management strategies to effectively manage merchant cash advance portfolios.

- Team Leadership:\\*\\* Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing team of risk analysts and financial professionals, promoting a culture of excellence, collaboration, and innovation.

- Financial Oversight:\\*\\* Oversee the assessment and management of financial risks, implementing proactive measures to safeguard company assets and drive financial performance.

- Collaboration:\\*\\* Partner with senior leadership to shape and refine financial policies, contribute to strategic decision-making, and support organizational objectives.

- Innovation:\\*\\* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging financial technologies to integrate innovative risk management solutions.

- Extensive Leadership Experience:\\*\\* Minimum of 10 years in financial risk management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role, preferably within the merchant cash advance or financial services industry.

- Proven Team Management:\\*\\* Demonstrated success in building and leading high-performance teams, with a track record of achieving results and fostering team development.

- Strategic Expertise:\\*\\* Deep knowledge of financial risk management principles and strategies, with a history of developing and implementing comprehensive risk management frameworks.

- Analytical Acumen:\\*\\* Strong analytical skills with experience in evaluating complex financial data to support data-driven decision-making.

- Communication Skills:\\*\\* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively to stakeholders at all levels.

- Educational Background:\\*\\* Advanced degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field preferred. Relevant certifications (e.g., CFA, CPA) are a plus.

title: Underage Purchaser
description:
Computer Evidence Specialists has been selected by the Federal government to serve as the Federal Tobacco Compliance Check vendor in New York. CES inspectors and underage purchasers will perform non-confrontational compliance checks on local tobacco retailers to ensure the sale of tobacco products to minors is restricted.

Ideal underage purchasers will be 16 – 20 years old, have a strong work ethic, and have sufficient free time to complete the assigned inspections with the inspector. Purchasers must complete the following forms which will be provided by CES: Parental Release, Medical Release, Underage Purchaser Agreement, Non-Disclosure Agreement and Commitment to Protect Non-Public Information.

Underage Purchaser Responsibilities:

* Complete short online training course.
* Access to a car is not needed for the underage purchaser.
* Purchaser will not deceive the retailer in any way.

*Will dress normally, use valid identification, and will not lie about their age.*

* Compensated at **$15.00/hour.**
* Applicants ages 18-20 will receive a background check

title: Art Gallery Assistant
description:
DDI's Art Gallery Assistant ensures that Main Street Masterpieces promotes the artistic work of the individuals that we support.


**Salary Range:** $22.95-$27.54/hour


### **Responsibilities:**


* Regularly assess the art gallery to ensure it’s clean, and looks presentable to the public
* Conduct regular audits of art inventory
* Label and maintain art gallery inventory database
* Assume key responsibility for the sale of artwork at the gallery. This will include maintaining an active catalog of all pricing for pieces in the gallery and management of inventory as a result of purchase transactions.
* Maintain all purchase transactions and ensure proper accounting records at all times. Responsible for following departmental protocols to ensure all sale money is properly safeguarded and transported to Finance.
* Gather sign in sheets from responsible parties, review and place in binder. Communicate any missed openings to the Recreation Coordinator
* Review sign-ups for newsletter, add to database of art gallery mailing list
* Assist with the planning of upcoming gallery events
* Provide training and assistance to groups opening up the gallery
* Provide ongoing art instruction to groups visiting the gallery
* Ensure that all art work is displayed properly (hung straight)
* Ensure that responsibility check off sheets are available at all times to groups opening the gallery
* Ensure website is on at all times and made available to visitors
* Work with Recreation Coordinator to ensure website is current and maintained
* Provide a pleasant greeting to any and all visitors to the gallery and inform them of upcoming events
* Ensure gallery lighting is maintained and any repairs/cleaning is requested in a timely manner

### **Qualifications:**


* HS Diploma required, Bachelor’s Degree in Recreation Therapy, Leisure Arts or related programs, preferred.
* Willingness to travel to multiple sites
* Ability to model recreational activities being taught as part of the job responsibilities
* Desire and ability to work with the DD/ID population

### **Essential Physical Demands:**


* Must be able to modify the area to secure the safety of the adults i.e. move/push tables and other heavy objects up to 20 lbs.
* Must be able to able to lift , bend, twist, carry a minimum of 35 lbs
* Must be able to run after an individual up to 500 feet
* Must be able to run to a program in need up to 500 feet
* Must be able to kneel, twist and bend
* Must be able to perform all physical SCIP techniques


*DDI is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to actual or perceived race, color, sex, pregnancy, reproductive decision making, gender expression or identity, national origin, disability, military status, creed, religion, age, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence or any other group protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating a deep sense of belonging and a culture where all applicants and employees feel welcomed, valued and respected. We are people inspired by purpose.*

title: Maintenance Tech 1
description:
**Summary**: A MH Mechanic 3 performs preventative maintenance, repair, labor and upkeep of facilities components and systems utilized by LGSTX Services. These systems include all types of work on conveyor systems, all components of conveyor systems and other material handling equipment. In addition this position may interact, inspect, and oversee contractors work.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.


* Performs minor reactive repairs and preventative maintenance on equipment as designated above.
* Possesses the ability to cut weld and fabricate.
* Follows technical manuals, blueprints, mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
* Safely operates all equipment associated with the manufacturing and demolition of conveyor systems, including fabrication /welding, and conduit and wiring installation and demolition.
* Assists with Troubleshooting, repairing, and constructing mechanical and electrical systems including compressors, air lines, diverters, cylinders, switches, VFD’s, control devices, and systems.
* Assists with Troubleshooting, repairing and installing electrical components with voltages from 12 volts DC to 480 volts AC.
* Assists with or follows work plan for emergency repair of critical assets. Work plan to include coordinating with operations, locating parts/tools for repair, scheduling time with equipment, etc.
* Learns and becomes proficiency with CMMS.
* Assists LGSTX Services and contractors on maintenance, modifications, and operations of equipment required and do so in keeping with our value of providing excellence in customer service.
* Performs clean up and general labor for material handling maintenance as requested.
* Available to work flexible schedules, including working all shifts, weekends and some holidays as per our customer’s production schedules and requirements. Overtime may be necessary as required.
* Demonstrates a professional attitude and is professional at all times.
* Informs supervisors immediately of problems, issues, material shortages, etc.
* Demonstrates flexibility with tasks and is adaptable to work changes.
* Possesses the ability to learn quickly and take direction from other more experienced mechanics and/or supervisors.
* Works with other departments, companies, or personnel at any time as required.
* Maintains all required paperwork, work orders, electronic records and reports in an accurate and timely manner.
* Ensures all equipment and work areas are kept in the highest possible state of repair and appearance.
* Follows all LGSTX and/or customer operating procedures.
* Is safety conscious at all times and ensures compliance with all company policies, federal, state and local regulations.


**Education and/or Experience**: Some experience or classwork with at least two of the following: 1) Basic preventative/predictive maintenance & troubleshooting skills and repair methods 2) Mechanical and/or electrical basic components 3) Welding and fabricating. Must be self-motivated with the ability work without direct supervision and/or as part of a team. Understands the safe use of power tools and other routine maintenance tools.


**Computer Skills**: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have basic knowledge of Microsoft Office and the ability to learn relevant company software programs. Basic knowledge or familiarity with using a smart phone.


**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations**: A current valid driver’s license.


**Work Environment**



While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, high, precarious places; risk of electrical shock and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to high.

#### **Experience**


Preferred* Must be self-motivated with the ability to work without direct supervision and/or as a part of the team
* Welding and fabricating
* Mechanical and/or electrical basic components
* Basic preventative/predictive maintenance & troubleshooting skills and repair methods

#### **Education**


Preferred* High School or better


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Emergency Service Project Manager
description:
**What does a Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager with Paul Davis do?**

* Serve your community when it needs it the most.
* Communicate with customers and adjusters the scope and expectations of a restoration project.
* Continuously learn about scoping, signing and managing construction projects, and improving results.
* Celebrate completion of projects with a team of skilled tradespeople, homeowners grateful to be back in their homes, and your Paul Davis team members.
* Have fun and be part of a growing business!

**Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager's** work with homeowners, businesses, adjusters, and sub-contractors after traumatic events such as fire or flood to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial properties., you will be on scene after property disasters to accurately scope projects, sign up the work, and oversee the execution of the restoration project (while controlling and communicating the budget effectively). This is an incredibly dynamic role, in which you will build relationships with insurance professionals, be the frontline contact with homeowners and set their expectations for restoring their properties back to health, manage your own budgets, and direct the work of Technicians and subcontractors. Your time will be spent both in the office as well as in the field to see your projects get completed properly.

**Why The Team Needs You?** Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and find ways to manage a team to complete projects successfully. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results and helping people.

**Why Join the Team?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York / New Jersey is headquartered in Queens, and has additional offices in Bergen County, NJ and in Manhattan. We serve the broader New York City, Long Island, and Northeastern New Jersey (Bergen, Hudson, Essex, etc.) areas. We have been consistently growing and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Estimator as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them into experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over 5 years.

**Our Values:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.

**Our Vision:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.

**Our Mission:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.

**Qualifications (Requirements):**

* High character with uncompromising commitment to honesty and integrity.
* Hungry and self-motivated, with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
* Willingness to respond to client/project needs, and genuine desire to help people in distress.
* Thrives under high performance, meritocratic environments.
* Strong attention to details, organizational skills, time management, and project management skills.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
* Ability to lead and develop teams.
* Career emphasis on learning and continuing education.
* Proficiency with current mobile and computing technology, and ability to learn new software.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience.
* Clean driving record and a reliable car (company pays generous car allowance and gas/toll reimbursements).

**Prior experience as a restoration project manager, construction project manager, estimator, or insurance adjuster are strong pluses** (but must be willing to learn a new process). Industry certifications or licenses (such as IICRC, Lead, Mold, etc.) also strongly preferred. If limited experience but you meet all qualifications, we will invest in your training!

**Role on the Team (Job Functions):**

* Meet operational objectives of: Sales, Gross Margin, Brand Experience, etc.
* Profitably scope, estimate, and sign projects to get started, then create work orders and manage the entire execution of the project while managing your own budget.
* Ensure compliance with regulations, standards, and service level agreements.
* Build relationships with insurance professionals, TPAs, and customers (both direct and B2B).
* Recruit, develop, and manage subcontractors/tradesmen; develop partnerships and improve team performance.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Significant opportunities for professional growth – 3 to 6 months of structured training to learn the Paul Davis Way, ongoing Leadership Development Program, 1-on-1 mentorship, and access to Paul Davis University and other regular ongoing training opportunities.
* Emotionally rewarding career. Not only are you helping people in time of need, but once fully ramped up, you will be given an extraordinary amount of autonomy and control over your work – fully trusted by the company to function as a "mini-CEO": managing your own budgets and teams, setting your own schedule, honing your style, and developing personal relationships (but with full support and mentorship from the company along the way);
* Highly competitive compensation structure, with base salary plus uncapped commissions based on projects completed. Our current Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager's yearly total compensations range from $50k (base salary before any commission, paid weekly) to >$200k depending on production. Candidates with significant prior experience as restoration project managers may qualify to start immediately as Senior Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager at higher base salary. Regardless of seniority, there is no limit to earning potential! We believe in meritocracy and rewarding high performers!
* Eligible for full benefits (an initial qualification period may apply), including: health, dental, vision and disability insurances; earned vacation and sick days; 401(k) with company matching; HSA with company matching; and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* Generous monthly cell phone allowances, car allowances, gas and toll reimbursements, etc.

The physical environment requires the employee to work all types of both indoor and outdoor conditions. Sometimes required to use personal protective equipment.

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Compensation Expectations
* Which of our values do you align with the most?

Work Location: In person

title: Investment Analyst
description:
**Senior Portfolio Analyst**   
This is a Direct Hire opportunity.  
This is a hybrid opportunity in Stamford, CT

**About this Position**

We are seeking a skilled Portfolio Analyst to join our team! This role involves working with a diverse range of clients, including Endowments & Foundations, Pension Plans, Family Offices, and Financial Intermediaries. As a Portfolio Analyst, you will be responsible for formulating investment policies, making strategic recommendations, and leveraging the company's portfolio construction process and research platform.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Provide advisory services, playing a key role in developing and delivering recommendations.
* Formulate investment policies and guidelines, offering insights on funds, strategies, and portfolio characteristics based on internal research and established viewpoints.
* Monitor portfolios with a focus on performance, risk, exposures, and alignment with overall asset allocation.
* Maintain strong relationships, ensuring loyalty and retention through exceptional service.
* Conduct annual reviews and thoroughly evaluate published research on alternative assets.
* Participate in meetings, act as a representative in formal consultations, and prepare necessary documentation.
* Meet with asset managers, provide reports and strategy summaries, and assist in preparing strategy timing reports.
* Conduct bespoke research, prepare presentations, and maintain a strong understanding of client objectives.
* Identify cross-selling opportunities and prepare portfolio risk models.
* Deliver accurate reports and recommendations, adhering to best practices in portfolio construction.

**Job Skills/Requirements**

* 5+years of relevant experience in the alternatives industry.
* Strong written communication skills and possession of or advanced progression towards relevant professional qualifications (CFA, CAIA, CPA).
* Proactive self-starter with excellent time management and multi-tasking abilities.
* Professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in systems such as Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook.
* Willingness to travel frequently.

**Additional Information:**

* Direct-Hire salary position
* Fully paid Medical and Dental PPO
* Fully paid Basic Life and AD&D
* 401k & FSA
* Everyday Wellness, onsite weekly yoga and fitness
* 30 days paid time off each year including Vacation and Holidays

**Pay:** 125k – 165k salary

We represent clients who support skills-first inclusive hiring practices. YUPRO Placement is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Security Officer
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has eight stores in Norwalk, Danbury, and Newington, CT, Farmingdale, East Meadow and Yonkers, NY, Paramus and Clifton, NJ. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Security Officer
  
Part Time hourly- Estimated pay range $18-$22 depending on qualifications and experience
  
Must be at least 18 years and older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

Provide a safe and secure environment for our TEAM MEMBERS and
  
customers. To protect the assets of the company and ensure minimal loss while
  
assisting with the maximization of profits.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Ensuring safety to all team members and customers
* Reporting all in store accidents to the proper departments
* Working as a team with other security officers
* Controlling traffic in a safe and orderly manner
* Provide exceptional customer service


**What you bring to the team:**  

* Entry level – 1 to 2 years experience.
* NYS Security License required
* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Valid driver’s license required
* Organizational skills and attention to detail are a must
* Great customer service
* Knowledge of the Bloodborne Pathogen standards.
* Basic knowledge of CCTV.
* Ability to be flexible in work schedule.
* Good oral communication
* Excellent work ethic


**Major Responsibilities:**  

Inspect interior/ exterior of building for physical security issues. Provide a safe
  
and secure shopping and working environment by ensuring that company safety
  
and security standards are met. Respond to issues requiring First Aid / CPR /
  
AED. Prepare incident and investigation reports. Educate Team Members in
  
safe practices and shrink control. Attend and support safety and department
  
communication meetings. Complete audits as directed. Occasional travel and
  
frequent use of company vehicles
  
  

**Examples of Daily Decision Making:**  

Administer First Aid or call for medical assistance.
  
  

**Working Conditions:**  

* Ability to work in extreme weather conditions (winter weather)
* This position requires frequent walking and standing and occasional exposure to weather


**Satisfy:**  

* Greet customers with a friendly smile and positive attitude, ensuring that each customer feels welcome and appreciated.


**Teamwork:**  

* Collaborate with team members to ensure the smooth operation of the store, offering assistance and support where needed.


**Excellence:**  

* Improve and maintain the efficiency of the store in order to reach success.


**Wow:**  

* Be a positive ambassador for the store, representing our S.T.E.W. values in all interactions with customers and team members. You are the biggest WOW!


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** High value, high quality Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, life insurance, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?
  
  

**Pay Day:** We’re thrilled to offer our employees Dayforce Wallet – a new way to get paid. Say bye-bye to pay day and hello to pay your way. Get your pay as soon as you earn it, at no cost to you – It’s your money, why should you have to wait? Request your pay as you earn it.
  
  

We take pride in the power of diversity, inclusion, and being socially responsible to the communities which we live and do business

title: Butcher Part Time
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has locations in Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Meat Cutter, level I
  
Full Time Hourly – Estimated pay range $ 20- $24 depending on qualifications and experience
  
Must be at least 18 years and older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

Meat Cutter, Level I, the highest level meat cutter with knowledge in all of the following areas: chop meat, pork/lamb/veal/, beef or gourmet. Meat products are prepared according to standards and customer preference, including cutting, weighting and trimming a wide variety of meats. Team members work safely and adhere to all food safety and sanitation standards in each area of the department to provide customers with the highest quality meats.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Cutting and preparing meat products, while safely operating equipment
* Custom trim meats to customer specifications
* Exam cases and prepare production list, based on day of the week, being mindful of sale items
* Maintaining, filling and rotating products in the meat cases
* Moving meat from cooler to cutting area
* Providing excellent customer service by greeting customers and responding to questions

* Training other team members, as needed
* Adhere to all health, sanitation and safety regulations
* Assist in other duties, as assigned

**What you bring to the team:**

* Problem solver

* Greet customers with a friendly smile and positive attitude, ensuring that each customer feels welcome and appreciated.

title: Cons-Tech Cons-AI and Data-End to End-Data Design and Mgmt-Manager-Mult Pos-1540476
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. **Consulting - Technology Consulting – AI & Data - End to End - Data Design & Management - Manager (Multiple Positions) (1540476), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, Hoboken, NJ.**

  

Support client engagement teams delivering professional services that focus on complex client business problems involving the acquisition, validation, and analysis of data in electronic form. Confer with client management and personnel to identify business needs, making assessments through process based diagnostic analytics, solution analytics, and enterprise analytics. Review reports and document findings to present to the team to help prepare recommendations for the client. Strategize and implement master data management, data governance, enterprise data management, enterprise content management and knowledge management. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Analyze data gathered using Enterprise Intelligence (EI) as a key enabler, and integrate analytics and business intelligence to provide solutions according to clients’ organizational policies and IT environment. Demonstrate strong project management skills, monitor engagement status, and manage staff performance. Utilize data strategy, data governance, data quality, data definition and usage, and data management to transform and improve clients’ organizations. Highlight key business issues the client may face.  

  

Manage and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Cultivate business development opportunities.

  

Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm.

 **MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**

  

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related field; and at least 5 years of post-bachelor’s progressive related work experience. Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related field; and at least 4 years of related work experience.  

  

Must have 4 years of experience in at least one or a combination of the following analytics tools:  

* ACL,
* Tableau,
* Spotfire,
* Microsoft SQL Server,
* SPSS,
* SAS,
* Business Objects,
* Cognos,
* Informatica,
* Trillium, and/or
* Data Stage


  

Must have 4 years of experience in at least one or a combination of the following modernized information management tool landscapes:  

* Talend,
* Collibra,
* Oracle DRM,
* SAP MDM,
* Informatica,
* Hyperion,
* Essbase, and/or
* SQL.


  

Must have 4 years of experience using analytics to solve business problems, monitor risks in business processes and apply analytic technologies to deliver value to the business.  

  

Must have 4 years of experience with ETL processes.  

  

Must have 4 years of experience advising clients on the full data supply chain from data wrangling to data consumption via analytics.  

  

Must have 4 years of experience in providing complex consultative services in at least one or a combination of the following areas:  

* information strategy,
* data architecture,
* information/data governance,
* master data management,
* data quality, and/or
* data integration.


  

Must have 2 years of experience in supervising a team of professionals  

  

Travel required up to 80% of the time, of which 10% may be international, to serve client needs.  

  

Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience. **Please apply on-line at ey.com/en\\_us/careers and click on "Careers - Job Search”, then “Search Jobs" (Job Number - 1540476).**

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary for this job is $140,084.00 per year. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


**If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**
**The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.****EY | Building a better working world**

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

This particular position at Ernst & Young in the United States requires the qualified candidate to be a "United States worker" as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor regulations at 20 CFR 656.3. You can review this definition at https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2011-title20-vol3/pdf/CFR-2011-title20-vol3-sec656-3.pdf at the bottom of page 750. Please feel free to apply to other positions that do not require you to be a "U.S. worker".

title: Remote Care Coordinator/Front Desk (Entry Level)
description:
Care Coordinator/Front Desk – Remote
  
Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is seeking a qualified, passionate Care Coordinator to join the team.
  
Care Coordinators are responsible for supporting patient care by making our patients feel welcomed and valued whilst also controlling the flow of the appointment. Care Coordinators are expected to respond to all phone calls and emails within 2 hours and always within 24hours. Care Coordinators will guide our patients through our out-of-network experience and greet all patients who enter the clinic with a smile. Care Coordinators are expected to execute 5-star customer service. Spear strives to foster a true community environment for both patients and team members; therefore, a collaborative spirit is valued to ensure everyone receives the care and support they need.
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Previous customer service experience.
* Someone who is hospitable, welcoming, and team-orientated.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi-task.
* A strong attention to detail and willingness to grow.
* BA.BS degree preferred, not required.


**WHAT WE OFFER:**  

We know that exceptional patient service can only be achieved when our team is well cared for.
  
We strive to create an environment that bolsters career growth while providing the flexibility and
  
time necessary to simply be a human being. Further benefits include:
  
* One Medical paid membership. Learn more at onemedical.com/business
* Mental Health benefits that include paid time off and support services through Journey Live & employer sponsored EAP program.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, Commuter FSA Plan.
* 401(K) Safe Harbor Match: SPEAR will make a matching contribution equal to 100% of the first 3% of annual compensation, plus 50% of the next 2% of annual compensation. The total SPEAR matching contribution will not exceed 4% of your annual compensation
* Generous paid time including PTO, Floating Holidays, Company Holidays, Mental Health
* Commuter FSA Plans – pretax savings plans for travel to & from work
* Employee Perks: discounted rates for entertainment, travel, fitness, insurance plans, etc. Gym membership discounts with Blink & Crunch Fitness.
* Company Events - Annual Summer Picnic and Holiday Awards Celebration


**SALARY:** $16 - $22 / hr
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

We value empathy in our team members and a dedication to clinical excellence -- whatever your workstyle -- above all else. While we are looking for both entrepreneurial big-thinkers and those dedicated simply to the day-to-day of treatment, successful candidates will understand that being clear is kind and that actions express priorities. No matter where you are in your career, we are positive you will find your niche with us and grow.
  
  

**Further success factors may include:**  

* Passion for the field hospitality and customer service.
* Self-motivation and willingness to go above and beyond.
* Enjoyment of seeking out an opportunity to make an impact daily and connecting with people.
* A proactive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude because we don’t work in silos.
* You celebrate wins and learn from losses with your patients, colleagues, and surrounding communities.
* A resonance with our SPEAR-IT values:
* Service
* Passion
* Empathy
* Accountability
* Respect
* Impact
* Teamwork


**ABOUT US:**  

Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is the nation’s leading outpatient practice. With more than 40 clinics in the New York Tri-State Area and 25 years of experience, Spear provides unprecedented patient access to physical and occupational therapy through its robust list of services covered by most major insurances. Since its founding, Spear has been honored by some of the top medical, academic, and business communities. Among these accolades, they have twice been named the nation’s top physical therapy practice by the American Physical Therapy Association and WebPT, received the Columbia Award for Leadership in Clinical Education, served as official therapists to Olympic teams and Broadway shows, and been featured for their expertise in The New York Times, CBS News, Good Morning America, The Today Show, and more. Learn more about Spear’s history of excellence at spearcenter.com.
company_description: Named the nation's top physical therapy practice twice, Spear is dedicated to providing excellent care and fostering excellence in its team.

title: Emergency Restoration Technician
description:
**WHAT DOES A MITIGATION TECHNICIAN WITH PAUL DAVIS DO?**  

* Serve others within your community in their time of need.
* Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property.
* Work hard and take pride in completing projects (i.e. mitigating flood and fire damage).
* Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology.

  

**WHY JOIN THE TEAM?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York is headquartered in Queens and serves the broader New York City Metropolitan Area. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Mitigation Technician as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them to become experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. Our employees are all treated with love, respect, and appreciation. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over five years.  

  

Mitigation Technicians will be responsible for providing on-site services to our customers, and will work in teams alongside Senior Technicians, Supervisors, and Management. Mitigation Technicians will be in frontline contact with customers during projects and must represent the company in a positive manner that builds customers’ confidence and trust in our work. Primary tasks include: (1) evaluating and recording damages to a building caused by water, fire, mold, storm, etc.; (2) cleaning and restoring damaged structures, using our professional and specialized equipment and techniques; (3) directly communicating with customers and coordinating with the Paul Davis team to provide extraordinary customer care; and (4) embodying our office’s core values of honesty, integrity, and safety. Mitigation Technicians may also from time to time be asked to support other aspects of our office's operations and growth strategy.  

  

**OUR VALUES:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**OUR VISION:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**OUR MISSION:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

**WHY THE TEAM NEEDS YOU?** Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. You will love being a technician if you take pride in your work and have a genuine interest in learning and helping others.  

  

**Reports To: Mitigation Manager**  

  

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**  

* High character with uncompromising commitment to honesty and integrity.
* Hardworking attitude, and adaptability to work hours that sometimes can be long or irregular (including on weekends).
* Ability to operate in hazardous environments with care and safety.
* Strong attention to details.
* Genuine desire to help other people.
* Demonstrated record of responsibility, teamwork, and respect for people and properties.
* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Legal authorization to work in the U.S.

  

**PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:**  

* 2-4 years of post-high-school education/training, or an honorable discharge from the U.S. Armed Forces.
* Construction, renovation, or handyman experience and knowledge.
* Technical proficiency with smart phones and tablets, and ability to learn new software and tools.
* Strong communication skills (both oral and written).
* Desire to learn new things and growth within the company.
* Ability to manage other people and projects.
* If limited experience but you meet all Position Requirements, it's okay; we will invest in your training!

  

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:**  

* Highly competitive hourly wage (varies based on experience level and personal growth), with significant opportunity for overtime pay each week.
* All employees paid weekly!
* Eligible for full benefits after 90 days of employment, including health and disability insurance, earned vacation days and sick days, 401(k) with company matching, monthly cellphone allowance, and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* Significant cross-training and career growth opportunities!

  

**NOTE:** If you have relevant previous experience and IICRC certifications, you may be eligible to start immediately as a Senior Mitigation Technician (and earn even higher pay).  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to be a team-player and deliver world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: Medical Billing Specialist (Podiatry Practice)
description:
The medical practice in Midtown and Downtown Manhattan is seeking a medical billing specialist. EXPERIENCE is required. The ideal candidate is energetic, personable, and with great communication skills who is interested in a long term position and growth with the practice.

**The requirements for the position:**

* Knowledge of medical billing/coding required preferably in Podiatry.
* Medical Terminology
* Experience is necessary
* Customer Service
* Attention to details
* HIPAA

**The duties include**

* Entering charges accurately to ensure fast payment responses
* Ensuring timely management of unpaid claims, and/or denials from insurances and/or clearing house
* Submitting claim corrections (errors) in a timely manner
* Researching and appealing denied claims
* Submitting medical record request documentation as needed
* Payment posting in a timely manner
* Monthly reports to management ad notifying management of any trends identified
* Insurance verifications and prior authorizations
* Reviewing patients statements for accuracy
* Ensuring strict confidentiality of financial records in accordance with HIPAA guidelines.

Company's website:  
www.toetalpodiatrynyc.com

**The ideal candidate:** 

Dependable- reliable

People-oriented- enjoys interacting with people

Flexible- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction

Detail- oriented- focus on the details of work

Achievement- oriented- enjoys taking on challenges

**Benefits**  
Pulled from the full job description

* Paid time off
* 401K pension plan

**Benefit Conditions:**

* Waiting period may apply
* Only full-time employees eligible

**Compensation offered is based on the candidate's experience ($30- $40 hourly rate).**

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

* Billing/ Coding: 2 years (Required)

Application Question(s):

* Do you have relevant experience working at the podiatry billing?
* Do you have excellent verbal and written communication skills?

title: Unarmed Security Officer
description:
Security USA, Inc, is a growing security company in the U.S. Our security personnel work days and nights in residential properties, commercial locations, non-profit organizations, government agencies and upscale retail in NJ, NY and Florida. Security USA employs the best candidates in the field that help make the difference for our clients.

**Some job site require standing for a long time**

**Weekly pay & we supply uniform.** 

**Responsibility**

As a leading security officer in a residential building, your role will be to ensure the safety and satisfaction of the community by performing a range of essential tasks.  
These include but are not limited to:

* Warmly greeting both incoming and outgoing tenants,
* Diligently monitoring the building and its surroundings through CCTV
* Ensuring that all guests and vendors adhere to the proper access control guidelines.
* Your duties will also involve securing the premises and offering security assistance whenever required
* Additionally, you will be responsible for providing incident reports and other necessary documentation to both building management and Security USA.
* Lastly, you will be expected to conduct regular patrols of the community shared areas within the building

Qualifications:

* To be considered for this position, the following will be required.
* Valid NY State Security Guard License
* 2 year’s experience is preferred but not required.
* Be physically capable of climbing stairs and patrolling
* Be at least 18 years old with a high school diploma or equivalent
* Must be Authorized to work in the US.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to write reports effectively, are essential.
* Positive and Customer-oriented attitude.
* Basic computer and smartphone proficiency will also be required.
* Prior Military or Law Enforcement experience is a bonus

Priority will be granted to applicants who possess flexible schedules and are available to work various times.

title: Behavior Technician for ABA Therapy - RBT Training Offered
description:
One of Fortune's Top Places to Work for Healthcare in 2023 and 5 years running!

Constellation ABA is looking for caring, compassionate, mentor-minded behavior technicians that want to teach individuals with developmental disabilities to thrive.

A Behavior Technician works with children on the autism spectrum to provide one-on-one Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) programming in the home-based setting.

**The peak hours for in-home behavior technicians are consistent Monday through Friday afternoons or early evenings for school-age clients, and occasionally weekends. There are extremely limited daytime hours available.**

Each available position requires 10-30 hours per week depending on client needs and flexibility. Job location is within 20-60 minutes of posted location.

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?

* **Highly competitive rates**
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* **Flexible hours**
* Continuing education
* **Most holidays and weekends off**
* Supervision and support to complete RBT credential
* **FREE online Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) training**

WHAT IS REQUIRED?

* Have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a behavioral health field, behavior analysis or a related field, plus one year of full-time equivalent experience providing ASD treatment services.
* OR have an associate’s degree or an equivalent number of credit hours with a passing grade from an accredited college or university in a behavioral health field, behavior analysis or a related field, plus two years of full-time equivalent experience providing ASD treatment services. Such experience may occur at any time, including before, during or after receiving the associate’s degree or any combination thereof.
* Experience working with children (preferably children with autism and/or special needs)
* Maintain a valid driver's license in applicable state and own viable transportation
* Travel to and from assigned client homes

WHAT DOES A BEHAVIOR TECHNICIAN DO?

* Implements one-on-one ABA programs developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in the client's home setting
* Collects and reports data for target behaviors to assigned BCBA supervisor
* Participates in behavior management programming for assigned clients
* Works with families and provides family training
* Participates in team building activities, meetings and ongoing training

NICE TO HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:

* Experience in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
* Registered Behavior Technician Certification (RBT)
* Bilingual

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance
* Travel reimbursement

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work Monday through Friday during afterschool hours?

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person
